description:
Price: Free

We are proud to present to you: Mobel, a users group based around mobile software development, design and UX. Mobel events will be organized monthly. These meetings are meant to present and exchange ideas about the challenges of developing good mobile experiences. The group will cover a broad range of mobile platforms (iOS, Android, Windows, …) and topics (Development, Technology, Design, …).


Our first session will be dedicated to Mobile Build Management. Maarten Balliauw, Alex Van Boxel and Alex Manarpies will show you how they configure and build their Windows 8/Windows Phone, Android and iOS projects using NuGet, Gradle and CocoaPods.

Maarten Balliauw is the founder of MyGet.org, delivering NuGet service in the Cloud. He will talk about NuGet, the technology used to manage dependencies in the Windows Phone Development cycle.
Alex Manarpies works as a Mobile App Consultant at iDA MediaFoundry and will give you a tour of what CocoaPods has to offer in terms of dependency management for iOS projects.
Alex Van Boxel is Software Architect at Vente-Exclusive. He will talk Gradle, the emerging build standard in the Android dev. world. The talk will also cover dependency management and setting up your own private repository.

The kind people at VRT have generously offered us a room, spread the word, we hope to meet you there.

To celebrate our kick-off, the talks are followed by a reception. We hope you’ll all stick around, so we can discuss the topics at hand.
name: Come and join us for our first event: Mobile Build Management

description:
Wim Janssens and Johan Ronsse will be talking about mobile UX and UI.

"Wim has a background in IT support and functional analysis for online development. He joined Monkeyshot 2 years ago and has extensive knowledge as UX Architect for larger online and mobile projects for different platforms. An active follower of mobile trends and platforms and helping clients create great User Experiences for their brands."


"Johan specialises in practical interface design, whether that means wielding a pencil, Photoshop or HTML and CSS. His life goal is to ship software that changes the world. He has eight years of experience designing all kinds of applications — from apps that help with business side processes to consumer smartphone apps for pretty much any platform you can think of."
name: Mobile UX & UI

description:
We’re glad to announce App Marketing, our next mobel meeting. Thomas De Vos (The Reference) will tell us the story behind the start 2 run app, and how it became successful in the stores. Matthias Barrie (Gouden Gids, Page D’Or) will give us an insight in strategies used to market a product using apps, and marketing apps themselves. Here’s some more info we got from the respective speakers:

Thomas De Vos about start 2 run:

For training center Energy Lab, the launch of the Start 2 Run meant their first introduction into the mobile market. During the first 3 months, the app has more than[masked] registered users, which means that the app is well received by as well individual users, companies, as event organisations. During the presentation of the Start 2 Run case, a closer look into the functionalities, the business model and the strategy behind the app will be offered and we will share some interesting lessons we have learned as a mobile app creator.

About Matthias Barrie and Gouden Gids

Since 2012, goudengids.be has been focusing on the booming mobile market. This has led to the development of several apps such as Aan Tafel, Urgent and Indomo, while new features have been developed for its yellow pages app in the meantime. In total, the goudengids.be apps now have over[masked] downloads and are leading apps in their segment. The success is partly due to the way the apps are introduced to the market, both to advertisers and users. This session will shed light on the marketing and communication campaigns driving the adoption of goudengids.be’s newborn apps.

Matthias Barrie holds Masters Degrees in Communication Sciences (Ghent University, 2008) and Marketing Management (Vlerick Management School, 2009).


He joined press agency Belga in 2009, followed by a research position at iMinds (formerly known as IBBT, the Insititute for BroadBand Technology). Since 2012 he is part of the marketing department at goudengids.be where he currently holds the position of Head of Native Products & Services, overlooking platforms such as goudengids.be (website and apps), Urgent, Aan Tafel and Indomo

This event will be hosted at Combell, your host on the internet. They were kind enough to offer us a room and some refreshments for you to enjoy!

Combell is an absolute market leader in hosting services for the enterprise, IT integrators and software developers. Combell, established in 1999, has grown to become the trusted one-stop partner for hosting of just about every type of IT infrastructure, website or application. Check them out at http://www.combell.com
name: App Marketing

description:
We return to VRT for our first hackathon session on iBeacons and NFC. We’ll be introducing proximity and vicinity API’s on different platforms (Android, iOS and Windows Phone). After this short introduction, you will have time to play with these different technologies on the platform(s) of your choosing. We’ll provide NFC tags, iBeacons, etc… To conclude the evening,  you’ll be able to present your master coding skills to the other attendees.

VRT was once again kind enough to sponsor this event, they’ll provide us with some fingerfoods and drinks and the Marconi studio to sit in.

See you there!

The mobel steering.

Agenda:

18:00 reception and chit-chat
19:00 technology overview
19:25 start of hackathon
21:30 project demo
name: iBeacons and NFC hackathon
